chargeHist.descr: Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death
Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death

result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).
  • Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Death, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Knowingly Operate w/out Valid License - Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Great Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(4).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

* Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP) or Substance Abuse Program (SAP) on Count #1.
**Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP) or Substance Abuse Program (SAP) on Count #2 through #6.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $20,923.65 and restitution surcharge. Restitution shall be made at a rate of 25% of any income earned by incarcerated.
-----------------------------

Not to operate a motor vehicle unless authorized to drive by State DMV and approved by DOC Agent.
-----------------------------
Not to possess or consume alcohol, enter into taverns, bars or liquor stores.
-----------------------------
Not to possess or use illegal drugs or to possess drug paraphernalia. 
-----------------------------

AODA assessment an counseling as directed by DOC Agent.
-----------------------------

Payment of restitution, court costs, surcharges and supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------
Attend Victim Impact Panel (VIP).
-----------------------------

Court in session at 1030 am. Defendant Andre Carroll appeared in custody via video. DA Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is on Motion Hearing today for court appointed attorney.  Court has reviewed letter. DA has not reviewed letter. Court summarizes letter on court record. Per letter SPD will not appoint counsel. State takes no position on the court appointing counsel other than court is not required to appoint. Court grants motion to appoint counsel. Last attorney was Attorney Renz; other counsel to be appointed by the Court. Schedule a Review Hearing for 30 days to see where case is on today's matter. Court in recess at 1034 am.
*MINUTES FORWARD TO COLLECTIONS DEPT*
Letter from Mr. Carroll seeking counsel

03:25 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Timothy A Suha appeared, by phone, for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deft Andre Carroll appeared by video means from Stanley Correctional Institution.  
Matter is here on Defendant's Motion for Postconviction Attorney.  
Deft says he did call SPD office & they indicated they needed more information.  
He did write them back but has not heard anything further from them.  
Atty Suha has not received any information about SPD appointment of counsel.  
3:33 pm  Court is not sure what do to and asks if Mr. Carroll wants this set off for a couple more weeks to see if he gets a response.  Court asks that Mr. Carroll send the Court a copy of the letter he received as to appointment of counsel.  Court will set a further hearing date.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 19, 2020 at 10:30 am.
Email, re:  Scheduling of video appearance for Deft - hearing 5/28 at 3:30 pm;

11:07 am  Court in session.  Case called.  
DA Zeke Wiedenfeld appears by phone on behalf of the State.  
Mr. Carroll appears by VIDEO from Stanley Correctional.  
Matter is here on Defendant's Motion for Post-conviction Counsel.  
Court notes a while back Judge Drettwan ordered an Attorney be appointed for him.  
Then last fall a Notice of Retainer was filed.  
Deft says that was an appointment for civil case and not this case.  
Court notes that Attorney put this case number (15CF353) on his Notice of Retainer.  
Then Atty Renz was on this case and Mr. Carroll requested that successor counsel be appointed and she withdrew.  
Deft has not requested the public defender to represent him.  Court questions why a court appointed attorney was appointed rather than going through SPD office.  Atty Wiedenfeld will check his notes about this.  He believes Deft may have had an SPD appointed Attorney at some point.  Atty Wiedenfeld believes an Attorney was appointed in 2017 by the Court.  Court sees that on October 11, 2017 Judge Drettwan denied without hearing, the defendant's Motions and then 9 days later she appointed Attorney Renz.  Deft says the Judge Drettwan approved the appointment of counsel.  Court notes that Atty Renz drafted a Motion and a letter was sent in October 2019.  Atty Renz filed a Motion to Reinstate his Post-conviction Motion which was denied.  Court notes that was just 809.30 Motions.  Atty Wiedenfeld doesn't believe it would preclude all motions.  Court requires he contact SPD office because Court can't appoint until the SPD office determines they cannot appoint an attorney for him.  Court directs defendant to contact the SPD office in Walworth County.  Atty Wiedenfeld believes he should probably be reaching out to the appellate division.  Phone number for appellate office in Madison - 608-266-3440 - PO Box 7862, Madison, WI  53707-7862.  
Court will put this off for approximately 1 month.  Court not addressing motion and not denying motion.  Court set new court date set for May 28 at 3:30 pm.  Deft to appear by VIDEO for next court dates.
Motion hearing on April 30, 2020 at 11:00 am.

Court's response to Motion for Appointment of Counsel - "I will grant this motion as Judge Drettwan did. Please appoint new counsel" PAK; 
4/15/2020 - Court's further response:  "Fee: Please put on for a 15 minute hearing, and Mr Carroll can appear by phone. PAK"  (df)

8:36 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Carroll in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  
Matter is before the court today for sentencing.  The Court has reviewed the PSI as well as the letters submitted this morning.  
Atty Bykhovsky has reviewed the pre-sentence with his client and has no corrections to the factual representations.  
State has complied with victim notification and consultation law.  
8:38 am  Statement by Andrea Pearson.  8:41 am  Statement by Jeffrey Marker.  
8:44 am  Statement by Aaron Pearson.  
8:48 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Donohoo.  
9:01 am  Statement by Steve Carroll, brother of defendant.   9:02 am  Statement by Mary Westphal, defendant's 7th grade teacher.  
9:05 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Bykhovsky.  
9:33 am  Statement by Defendant.  
9:34 am  Court in recess until 10:00 am  
9:59 am  Court in session.   Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the Defendant.  

Ct #1:  Total length of sentence:  10 yrs; 5 yrs IC followed by 5 yrs ES  
Ct #2:  Total length of sentence:  6 yrs; 3 yrs IC followed by 3 yrs ES, consecutive  
Ct #3:  Total length of sentence:  2 yrs; 1 yr IC followed by 1 yr ES, consecutive  
Ct #4:  Total length of sentence:  2 yrs; 1 yr IC followed by 1 yr ES, consecutive  
Ct #5:  Total length of sentence:  2 yrs; 1 yr IC followed by 1 yr ES, consecutive  
Ct #6:  Total length of sentence:  2 yrs; 1 yr IC followed by 1 yr ES, consecutive  

155 days of SENTENCE CREDIT  
Court finds defendant NOT eligible for CIP or SAP on Ct #1  
Court finds defedant IS eligible for CIP and SAP on Cts #2 thru #6  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Not to operate a motor vehicle unless authorized to drive by State DMV and approved by DOC Agent.  2)  Not to possess or consume alcoholo, enter into taverns, bars or liquor stores.  3)  Not to possess or use illegal drugs or to possess drug paraphernalia.  4)  AODA assessment and counseling as directed by DOC Agent.  5)  Payment of restitution, court costs, surcharges and supervision fees.  6)  Restitution payments shall be made at a rate of 25% of any income earned by incarcerated.  7)  Attend Victim Impact Panel.  

10:10 am  Court in recess.

*TRANSCRIPT FILED 7/12/2017 - Court Reporter Linda Matoska (KO)
Defendant Andre  Carroll in court with attorney Eugene Bykhovsky.  Matthew R. Leusink and Diane Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Consent and Order to For Substitution of Counsel

4:05 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deft Andre Carroll in court with attorney Atty Eugene Bykhovsky 
Also present is Atty Travis Schwantes.  . 
There is a Motion before the Court for Substitution of Counsel.
There is no objection by the State.  Court signs the Order granting substitution of counsel.  
4:05 pm  Attorney Schwantes is excused.   
The FPT and JT currently scheduled will be canceled at this time 
4:06 pm  Atty Bykhovsky needs time to review discovery and also determine if they need to retain their own expert.
Atty Bykhovsky is asking for 30 days to file Motions.  Court would consider allowing more time than that.  
Defendant is withdrawing his speedy trial demand.  
Court notes that Atty Schwantes had also sent a letter indicating there was some outstanding discovery.  
Atty Donohoo indicates all of the discovery has been provided (as of February 17th)
Atty Donohoo advises that the State's deadline for its current offer is March 30th.  
If not accepted on the record by that date, the offer will be withdrawn and will not extended again. 
Atty Bykhovsky was just made aware of it today before going on the record.
Court will allow 60 days for any Motions to be filed - deadline of May 10, 2016
4:11 pm  Court in recess.  
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
